bug.short_desc: dnfdragora crashes while running large updates
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: Dnfdragora crashes while installing large update. However as dnfdaemon continues to run the update successfully completes. Only occurs with large update, tested with 238 packages requiring update.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): 1.0.0-3.git20170226.ae5163e.fc25
How reproducible: Always occurs. Tested in Fedora 25 Xfce (also occurred in Korora 25 Xfce and Mate). Only occurs with large number of packages, tested with 238 packages requiring update. Update transactions with around 20 - 30 packages ran successfully.
All tests were run in VM using kvm.
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Install a Fedora 25 system (or use system that hasn't been updated for some time), install dnfdragora 2. Run dnfdragora and select all updates, select check all and apply. 3.
Actual results: dnfdragora will show the download of 25 - 50% of packages and then the gui will crash. Observing top shows dnfdaemon is still running and if allowed to run will successfully complete the operation which can be confirm by the dnf history command.
Expected results: dnfdragora will continue to display progress and will reload when update is completed. This is the observed behaviour when doing an update with a small number of packages.
Additional info:
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 1436451 ***
